intro: Khadia alticola, commonly known as the alpine khadia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Khadia alticola plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
